summary: An FBI Special Agent emails an unknown recipient to notify them of upcoming travel to their Area of Responsibility (AOR) to conduct victim/witness interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. The travel involves three Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs), with interviews planned at a lawyer's office and a hotel conference room.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the investigation along with Ghislaine Maxwell; the email discusses travel to conduct interviews related to their case.

events.title: Travel notification for victim/witness interviews
events.description: An FBI Special Agent sends an email notifying an unknown recipient of planned travel to their Area of Responsibility (AOR) to conduct victim/witness interviews in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York VCAC/HT

keyFacts: The FBI was actively conducting victim/witness interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein/Ghislaine Maxwell investigation as of February 2020.
The investigation involved collaboration between FBI agents and three Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs).
Interviews were planned to be conducted at a victim/witnesses' lawyer's office and a hotel conference room.
The email indicates ongoing investigative efforts in the Epstein/Maxwell case, even after Epstein's death in 2019.
